reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Property is a little expensive for the location but the staff treats Platinum members very well and the rooms are modern, clean, and relatively quiet. Breakfast downstairs is a bit expensive but that is expected for purchasing food in a hotel. All in all it was a solid stay.
reviews.title: Solid Stay

reviews.text: Our family spent one evening here. Room was average nothing special. Air conditioning seemed a bit weak and the room was hot all night. More expensive than surrounding hotels but lacked value for the money. Had Starbucks coffee shop but the coffee was not at the correct temperature and was not very hot. I asked about that and the server just took my coffee and put it in the microwave oven as if she has done this before. My Starbucks black coffee tasted like sludge after she did that. I threw it in the trash on the way out. Might want to re calibrate your equipment in the coffee shop.
reviews.title: A pleasant stay nothing special

reviews.text: Like many others this hotel in Beckley WV is an "oasis" in the hills. Hotel was modern looking and fresh. We did not get requested bed size - they were full. Bed was similar to a foam style bed if you like that... We didn't. As a top tier Marriott traveler they also don't even provide you a cup of cofffee much less breakfast in the monring. We asked why and they cited some reason that didn't seem plausable. We would try another place when passing back through. There are many options in that area actually.
reviews.title: No free breakfast or even a coffee- rooms clean- beds tough - AC cold

reviews.text: Courtyard has gone hip. Very nice furnishings. Clean, modern amenities without musty odors. Starbucks at the basic coffee bar in lobby. Flat screens galore. Nice balconies and outside patio areas.
reviews.title: New decor is beautiful - not your grandfather's Courtyard.

reviews.text: Pleasant friendly staff.
reviews.title: here again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Especially well appointed hotel room located right in the heart of town. Easy access to freeways. Very personable staff who are most helpful in answering your questions & giving directions. One drawback is that there is no free breakfast which most of the hotels in the area provide. Think the prices for breakfast, etc. are on the pricey side.
reviews.title: Very well appointed hotel
Watch Out For Police Ticketing in Parking Lot
reviews.text: We stayed at the Courtyard on April 28. The room was clean, comfortable and quiet. All was great until we were loading the car and discovered a $100 ticket for parking in a handicapped space despite the handicapped placard being displayed in the windshield. After contacting the local police, we were told that if we came to the station and produced the placard, they could dismiss the ticket. Thankfully, the front desk copied the placard and faxed it to the police and that sufficed so the ticket was dismissed (I hope). The folks at the Courtyard could not have been more helpful.

I recently stayed here twice for work, and I wish I wouldn't have booked the hotel for the second trip. The hotel seems to believe it is of a higher quality and standard than it is or should be in this area. There is not free breakfast and the price of food or drinks in their "cafe" or "market" are outrageous. I paid over four dollars for a bowl of cereal and a banana. A chocolate milk was over two dollars. The gym is a joke. It is the smallest gym I have ever seen at a hotel and the equipment is laughable. The rooms are nice, but have a very funky layout. The rooms are like playing a game of Russian roulette. Unexpectedly yo may have a refrigerator and a balcony or neither on various stays. The hotel is noisy due to its location to the interstate. I would recommend staying anywhere else. The only and I say only plus to this establishment is its proximity to places to eat.
reviews.title: There are better hotels in Beckley

reviews.text: We stayed here one night for $142. There was no refrigerator in the room, no lotion and really small shampoo/conditioners. Also, you had to pay for the breakfast and there was little selection. For the price we paid, you would think these amenities would be over the top. Bed was comfy, staff was very friendly and room was clean. I will look elsewhere for our next stay in this area to get our monies worth.
reviews.title: Lacking amenities for price paid

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel is right off the highway, has large bedrooms with ver comfortable beds, spartan and small bathrooms but very clean. Our room did not have a mini fridge but did have a small coffee maker. On arrival the front desk was under staffed and not helpful. On leaving at 6 a.m there was no one at the front desk which worried me, although I felt safe during our stay. There is ample free and well lit parking and an adequate pool and exercise room. If you are looking for freebies, this is not the place to stay. They do not even offer coffee in the lobby in the morning and there are no upgrades if you are a Marriott Gold member. We paid $129 for our room which I feel was too much but there are not many Marriotts around, except a Fairfied Inn across the street and the hotel was full, so they can demand that price. There is a restaurant in the hotel and several restaurants right across the street which is very handy. If you plan to go to The Outback, reserve a table before checking in, as it is very busy or ask to eat at the bar and you will probably be seated right away.
reviews.title: Convenient but somewhat overpriced.

reviews.text: Stayed here during the Greenbrier Classic PGA golf tournament. They made special arrangements for us when we only had rooms much further away since I am a gold member. Management was great to work with when splitting cost of room between two people. Close to restaurants and events in the area.
reviews.title: Wonderful staff!!

reviews.text: Our stay on the way home from Myrtle Beach was nearly flawless.
reviews.title: Very comfortable - Excellent Staff

reviews.text: The room was large and comfortable, and the hotel was clean and fresh.
reviews.title: Relaxed after a long drive...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There were also enough towels for all four family members - something other Marriotts can't seem to do.
reviews.title: Clean, Comfortable and Well-Located!

reviews.text: The only negative thing I can say is that we had food we needed to keep refrigerated and the room didn't come with a fridge.
reviews.title: Great hotel for short stay
Great stay
reviews.text: We recently stayed here on our way home from Florida and were extremely pleased. The room was spacious, the beds comfortable, and the hotel is in a great location-convenient to the freeway. There is a McDonald's, Outback Steakhouse, and several other restaurants close by. The staff was very friendly and helpful. I would only suggest to put more towels in the bathroom as there were only 2 for 4 people.

We pulled into the Beckley Courtyard without a reservation on a trip north during spring break. The staff was very friendly and accomodating. We had a lovely clean room, there were lots of restaurant options nearby. It was a nice surprise stop for us and we would recommend this spot.
reviews.title: Great stop on the way north
Wonderful surprise...what a great place!
reviews.text: We actually ended up reserving a room here a few days before our stay only because the Fairfield (also by Marriott) was full so they recommended the Courtyard which was just across the parking lot. My husband and I were only staying one night as we were passing through en route home from Florida. What a fabulous little place! The entire hotel looks as if it has been renovated in recent years and the lobby is very spacious, modern, and welcoming. I was especially impressed with the lovely room we had...super clean and the decor was like nothing I had ever seen in a similarly priced hotel...loved it! Great layout also...I wasn't actually in the room long enough to really enjoy it but appreciated it while I was there. The bed was fabulous (as it felt much like my own) and if it had been a warmer time of year we would have enjoyed the small balcony as well. I was a bit disappointed that there was not a complimentary breakfast offered but they do have a lovely cafe area where there is breakfast available for reasonable prices. I think this hotel has quickly become our new preferred spot to stop on our way to and from Florida for future vacations.

What a great place! It is very close to the exit for travel ease. There are also lots of choices of restaurants. The front desk personnel was very friendly and welcoming. The room is well layed out for a family of 4 to be comfortable in! We would definitely come back!!!!
reviews.title: Awesome!

reviews.text: We had a great stay while we went skiing at WInterplace. The hotel was clean and definitely seemed to be going for an "aLoft" vibe with the lobby furnishings and the bar. Breakfast isnt included but was good and probably no more than going to Bob Evans. Staff was friendly.
reviews.title: Great Stay in Beckley
